intro: Campanula aprica, commonly known as the early bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to central and southern Europe and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue to violet and are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Campanula aprica thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
